review: If your food of choice involves chicken, this place is for you, because 90% of the dishes here are chicken-based.  After all "chicken is so versatile".  I'm no huge fan of chicken, with all its dirty warehouse processing and their poor living conditions...but all PETA aside, this place is overrated.   I decided on nachos and was ready to order when the waitress came.  She asked me if I wanted the "9 or the 12".  So I just had to ask "The nine or the twelve what? I want nachos!" So she explained to me that the nachos there were counted out and each chip had toppings on it.  So I just had to mess with her.  I told her I wanted the 13. Stupid me, I didn't realize our country had such a corn chip shortage (smack HEAD!)....Well I certainly wanted to do my part to chip in (pun intended); wouldn't want the less fortunate not to have their chip rations for the week. Imagine the chaos of a chip rebellion in this country--poor, ragged indigent people with salsa jars in their hands with nothing to dip in it.  The horror!  Deciding that was too much stupidity for me, I changed my order. I got a cheeseburger. Not sure what it was called-something to do with an avocado, b'cus there was a slice of avocado on it-duh! Not bad, but nothing great for the price.   Also a pet peeve of mine is when restaurants pre-salt their fries.  WTF is with that?  Can't they trust me to season my own damn fries? My girlfriend had the chili and was repulsed.  I tasted it and it and found that it to be a thin gruel seasoned with chili.  You'd think a place called Chili's could do a decent chili!  The feck?!  Garbage!
I went twice because it is close to my place....Great place to hang out with friends....will visit more. the staff were friendly too

I'm sitting here right now watching my friends eat lunch... Why am I not eating you ask?  Because I am deathly allergic to onions and our lovely waitress could not be bothered to check and find out something I could eat. She checked on the one thing I asked about and then said "sorry a lot of our stuff has onion in it."  Really?  No, really?  In front of her I closed my menu and told my friends to order saying I just won't eat, if they have nothing I can eat..  She didn't even attempt to ask a manager or chef to find me something.  She didn't even suggest I order dessert.  It is absolutely not okay to let your customer sit here and watch others eat, Ms. Christina.  I will never come here again after this experience.  After being made to feel like it's ok for me to just not eat rather than her taking the time to ask anyone else what is onion free, I'll take my business elsewhere where they do care and I hope you do too.

Have visited several times before with mixed results. Took my grand daughter out for a girl's night. We were there early  on a Saturday about 4.  Waitresses were nice  and attentive until we got our food. Food was good but nothing spectaculsr.  When the food arrived I indicated I needed a refill of iced tea. We finished our meals and still no refill. We looked over the desserts and decided on one. Grand daughter and I waited another 10 minutes watching our waitresses go bye without a nod to us. After we started putting our coats one of the waitresses asked if we wanted dessert. Told her we did 10 minutes ago and I wanted a drink over 20 minutes ago but we don't want anything but the check now. She prompted brought it. As we walked out the hostess asked us to wait as the manager wanted to give us a gift certificate. I declined as I will never go back.  I am a local resident and will take my money elsewhere.

I eat at Chili's when I am jonesing for Steak Fajitas.  We usually eat in the bar area, and except for a miss here and there, it usually lives up to my expectations.   One lunchtime nearly 6 months ago, I ate here with friends.  We had the 2 server tag-team thing.  Neither of them could be bothered with us (3 at our table on a tight lunch schedule).  We did order, but the food was very long in coming out.  We finally asked the manager and it was brought by her.  Never really saw our team, until of course the bill was presented with a smile and a "hope you enjoyed everything."  Unfortunately for her that day, one member of our party was not having it and insisted on the manager coupons. 1 star for lack of service. Another time, several months ago, I took my daughter and her boyfriend here for dinner and their steaks (ordered mid-rare) came out after a long wait very well-done.  They got sent back and after another very long wait (during which time the others in the party completed our meal) their steaks arrived.  The server blamed the kitchen saying yes, she did put it in mid-rare.  The manager came out and said, we are very sorry about that.  And that was it.  A 2 to 3 star experience due to service. Now we got on a streak and several months go by where everything is hot and yummy.....mmmm..... As with all streaks, this one had to be broken.  As we were sitting in the bar, I ordered a cordial afer dinner drink straight up (neat, though I said, and it was verified, straight up, no ice).  It was brought with ice.  And sent back since I did not want this beverage cold.  We watched and it sat on the bar counter for a few minutes, the bar tender poured off the cordial into another glass and gave it back to me.  Now it was cold and watered down.  I watch enough Restaurant Stakeouts and Mystery Diners and anything Gordan Ramsey to know that this is a no-no...  it was 4 stars up to that point, but took a nose dive to 2.... Now we come to today.  I didn't bring my lunch to work and pretty much didn't really want fast food.  Ahhh....let's give Chili's To Go a try.  I order the Chicken Fajitas Combo.   I picked it up in the bar of the restaurant and took it back to work.  (I work like a few minutes away).  I forgot to mention I got a side of onion strings, and who can resist partaking on the drive back.  They were stone cold as soon as I got them.  Still tasty, because after all, they are deep fried onions.  But cold...not warm or tepid.  Cold.  I opened up the Fajitas. Every thing was cold except for the flour tortillas, which were pretty hot.  3 of the pieces of chicken were raw in the very middle (see above love of all things Gorden Ramsy and I could hear him disgusted in my head) and the onions and peppers were not "fajitacized."  It was so sad.  I made up a fajita with the safe chicken and veg and stuff.  By this time the tortillas were solidifying (spare me the use of micro-waves in restaurants!).  Frankly, it was just...ICK.   Half star (I was going to type 1/2 but was afraid it might be equated to 1-2 stars) for food and I hope I don't get sick, but my office is very close to the ladies' room so I should be good... I just think my relationship with Chili's is at it's end.  So sad.

I've sat down for lunch here as well as ordered for online for take-out and had no problems. They were on time with my food and gave me a large soda instead of the small. They oversalt the fries and chips! I had chips with their Spinach Dip and the salt was practically falling off. I had to brush some of the salt off to eat them! But if you sign up for their email listerv thing they send you coupons every 3 days for free appetizers and desserts. If you love sodium, I highly suggest Chilis!

Usually it's one of my favorite restaurants, but we have had mediocre to downright rude service in more than one occasion. The managers seem to be pretty attentive, but they don't offer much in the way of consolation when the service is terrible and the bartender has been rude. The food is always good, just don't expect the waitstaff to be good.
Southwestern chicken pizza was horrible and cold. They took it back and warmed it up but it did not improve it at all!  Worst meal I've had In a long time!

No better than we remember this chain or this location being. Don't know why we bothered trying it again!  Vegetarian - unfriendly, soggy lettuce,  subpanel over baked fish. They misfired on everything we ordered. The pretzel sticks were the only ok item!

This place has been my go to place for years. Today I stood at the front door for fifteen minutes waiting to be seated in an empty restaurant. That was very frustrating. But once I got seated the service was great and the food too. I love the 2 for $20 deal. It's great. Be sure to try the margarita flat bread!!

Ohhhhh, Chili's, what have you done to your steak fajitas?! Went here with work mates the other day, as a sort of impromptu holiday luncheon. It was the second time I'd been there since our offices moved up Cockeysville way, and I typically opt for a local place for a better lunch, or the local Subway for a more pedestrian lunch. The first visit doesn't even stick out in my mind, and I presume the food didn't impress me enough that I chose to make the time and effort to post a review (I'll often give a place a second chance, which is why I don't have all that many one and two star reviews). This time around the food took a long time to arrive, and one of our party was given the wrong beverage. And my fajitas were so very, very disappointing. Don't know what Chili's has done as far as recipe changes, but the new fajitas - and mine were overcooked - tasted very heavily of black pepper. YUCK! Don't think I'll be returning, especially with so many other nearby options.

I like Chili's, I really do. I can't explain why... But I do. However, this place now has those screens on the table and it seems like once a restaurant gets those, it becomes all about throwing you out the door (see the nearby Applebee's for more on this).  When we sat down, we were given out menus and not even a minute later, our server came out and asked us if we were ready to order. She then reappeared two minutes later when not one person in our four person party had closed their menu, and once again asked us if were ready... And then two minutes later... Again! This pushy service has got to stop.

There is something different about this Chili's.  It is physically attached to a Holiday Inn.  The HI uses it as its lunch/dinner restaurant and bar. That means it can be unusually busy. Other than that a Chili's is a Chili's is a Chili's. Three star food accompanied by three star drinks served by three star and occasionally four star wait staff. I was at the hotel for several days and I used the bar here to keep up with the World Cup. The quality and number of TVs was just fine.   It got the job done.

The enchilada dishes are great and plenty on the plate, my usual go-to item if at a tex-mex spot. Some eateries serve two..which leaves me hungry; Chili's puts out three which is right.  If you bring children, avoid the bar half. It's attached to a hotel/within a business park area; hotel stayers and senior business men inappropriately obsess over young female bar staff trying to deal with them asking about their school/college/studies/etc.

I had to write this.  We met up with about 20 members of our family visiting from out of town and went to Chili's unexpectedly for dinner.  We were pleasantly surprised by every aspect of our time there -- the food, the service - the whole package.   Our waitress was amazing - attentive, forgiving of our constant need for straws, refills on our drinks, and the need for a fair amount of time between appetizers and the meal. I ordered the vegetarian burger and was surprised by the good taste of the actual bean burger, as well as the great presentation.  I'd just like to say, Go Chili's.  Thanks for helping to make this dining experience with my extended family wonderful in every way.  We all liked our meal very much and particularly the excellent service we received.   Good service, good food and great prices!

Love this Chili's! My friends and I come here all the time! Kristine (not sure how to spell her name) is an awesome bartender! Food is always consistent. We usually sit in the bar and the servers are always friendly. They will always give us extra sour cream and are always right there to refill drinks, etc. Nachos are so yummy. Always have a good time here! Never had a problem. I don't normally like chain restaurants but this particular Chili's is really great. :)
The appetizer and beers were just fine. The rest of the meal was cold and unappetizing. Our waitress was very nice and we enjoyed her service.

Have been to this location a few times. Each time I have been satisfied with the service and food. This time we were introduced to their table top computer which allows you to pay right at the table if using a card. It was quick and easy. Even could leave a tip and use a coupon with the computer service. I think if you pay with cash you still have to go through the waitress, but this seems more secure than giving your card for them to take someplace else as well as using an email coupon that was on my phone- I would not want to give my phone to anybody to take elsewhere. Service was fast and friendly.
Inattentive waitstaff. Oversalted and seasoned food. Items Included in order not delivered to table. Incorrect change returned. Place has really gone downhill.
Having a late dinner with Angie. Had a Rocking week and it is time To relax.  Looking forwArd to watching the Ravens game tomorrow

My wife and I went on a Saturday evening arriving at 7:15.  Quite busy but the crowd appeared to be moving.  Was told the wait would be "about 35 minutes."  Then noticed people who came in after us being seated, some twosomes and some larger groups. At the one hour mark I approached the young man who was handling the seating and asked him where we were in the queue. He had to dig through 3 sheets of paper (?) and it was obvious he had lost our reservation. I got the "escape" comment, "You are next on the list."  Seated at the table and waited another 10 minutes before a waitress showed up.  I asked to see the manager, and I voiced my displeasure to him.  He was kind enough to comp our drinks. Placed our order from the Two-for-Twenty menu; seems like a good value.  Onion ring appetizer was excellent.  My wife got the bacon cheeseburger - really good - and french fries - blah. I got the half rack of ribs with a side of their NEW skillet smoked potato wedges. First the potatoes; unpleasant smoky taste accompanied by a white dipping sauce that tasted like lemon yogurt.  Does anyone really like this combination?  The ribs; most other rib joints would consider this a child's portion.  Six ribs that probably contained no more than two ounces of meat in total.  Tasted okay, but not what could be considered a dinner portion.  Very disappointing visit.  Only the comp drinks, cheeseburger and onion rings elevated this from a one star to two stars.

I went here after going to the beer bourbon bbq festival at Timonium fair grounds.  I was staying at the holiday inn and this chilis is attached.  It was a rainy Saturday night and j did not feel like driving so this location was convenient.  Was going to sit in but there was at least a 45 min wait for a table on the restaurant side.  The bar was jam packed as well so I was forced to the Togo window.  My food was prepared in about 20-25 min.  Everything tastes like you would expect from chilis.  Great prices dinner for two for 20 bucks.   Would have been a solid 3 stars but looks like their staff could not keep up with the business volume this place does.

Okay, staff are nice.   Food is good but your average easy going type of place.   Wish the menu was a little more varied.   Seems like lots of Mexican food and a few burgers.   I love Mexican, but I'd like to have a few more options.   We ordered fried pickles, they were a bit on the greasy side and kinda had a fishy taste to them...you can tell they must have been fried in the same oil that something fishy was.  Im funny with that I can tell when my fries are like that so it may be just me.   I'd go back, but maybe try the fajitas instead of the burger, which the roll was much to Bready for me.

I wasn't expecting four star quality food but the salad that they brought out to me was unacceptable. Drenched in dressing, cold chicken, stale quesadilla. I had to send it back because I felt like I was eating a soggy bowl of lettuce.  The service was mediocre but at least the server tried to keep our drinks filled. Went to the bathroom on my way out and the restrooms are a great representation of how dirty the restaurant is.  Please pay more attention to the food you are bringing out to customers. With so many restaurants to choose from, improving quality of product will go a long way.
Good as always.. Could possibly consider doing "curbside" for to go. They do this at other establishments and I know first hand it Would definitely result in a larger tip.

Today is a special day - Veteran's Day. I would like to take this opportunity to thank you for offering a free meal to military veterans at Chili's in Timonium. We sincerely appreciate your recognition of our men and women who serve and have served to allow us to live freely in this great country.  Thank you so much for your generosity and kindness to all of our veterans.  We enjoyed our lunch today.

Super friendly staff and you never have to wait for a table because the place is so large. Food is fresh and plentiful and hot when it arrives. Desserts are big and REALLY great. It would be nice if they would bring back the fried ice cream pretty please! Also the sound quality is fine even when it is crowded. Very easy place to come back too!!

We sat at the bar and ordered boneless buffalo wings that were not crisp but almost soggy. We ate less than half of the order.  We also ordered  the quesadilla salad. The chicken on the salad was moist and good. However, the salad was drowning in dressing. I guess I should have ordered it on the side. I ate about a third of it.  The server cleared the plates without asking how we enjoyed the meal. It wasn't until she was about to give us the check did she ask. We told her the issues and that it was no big deal. She didn't offer to reduce the bill  and said it would be a hassle to get the manager but said next time we go to tell her that we had an issue and she would take care of it.  With so many options in the area there won't be a next time.

The wife loves their Ranchero chicken tacos, the ribs used to be great, but the past few times have been so overcooked they were barely edible. However the ancho salmon  and the southwest eggrolls are very good. So, its hit or miss.

Chili's is usually a great experience, and this was no exception. Restaurant was clean & service was friendly. Restaurant employs the modern Chili's design; not an older interior. Attached to a hotel but open to the public.

The place was great. Waitress was right on time, food came out on time even we asked for em to wait to bring out the drinks. Food was delicious. Only problem was when you walked in and near the bar it smelled horrible. It smelled like the sewer was backed up. Definitely only problem, everything else was amazing.

I came with my family to this chilis, the waiter was very nice , he was very patient. He suggested several items based on our preference.  The food quality was better than most of the other chilis I been too . I will definitely come to this chilis anytime I will be in mood for Mexican
This location is always tops in taste, service, and price. On our most recent visit I ordered the baby back ribs and they were excellent in every respect.

(7/29/2016)  UPDATE.  They've tried to update the menu with more fresh options even wheatberries and quinoa, and that restaurant gold, avocados.  People will pay more for anything with avocado or "fresh" guacamole (us included).  It was probably too optimistic to expect really fresh guacamole from a Chili's.  The molcajete came to the table with the already mashed avocado in it, all the server did was mix-in some diced red onion, pickled jalapeno, and diced tomato, left us with 1 lime wedge.  Likely these were frozen avocado halves or pulp that they thawed in the microwave.  Yeah, I saw that life hack on the interwebs, too, "How to instantly ripen an avocado in the microwave."  It didn't work when I did it either.  That's what this guacamole tasted like with the dry texture, too.  The  2 for $20 still the best deal. Had the Honey Chipotle BBQ on both the Half Rack (fall off the bone) and Chicken Crispers (flaky crispy), both decent.

Ok, so I came to Chili's last night and ordered a steak. I don't really have super high standards for chain restaurant steaks but this steak was perfect! I was very pleasantly surprised. I got the 10oz medium rare and it was cooked perfectly and so tender, not chewy at all. The skillet mashed potatoes were also very good! I will say that service was very slow during my visit last night, that was the only disappointing part. My absolute FAVORITE type of dessert is a warm, gooey cake, cookie, or brownie with ice cream on top. Chili's has so many desserts right up my alley with their molten cakes and skillet cookie-- yum!!

I ordered the  "3 for me" for $10 (house salad, carnitas fajita, and molten cake)...a real bargain! I love the casual atmosphere...and the music...Dan (our waiter) was very attentive...my wife and granddaughter shared flatbread pizza with avocado, grilled chicken and bacon...the food was all excellent and plentiful...free refills on soft drinks...consistent quality and service...a great family place

After dining at the Chilis in White Marsh about a month ago I honestly did not want to return.  I spoke to my amazing parents about the restaurant they mentioned going to the Timonium location where we did enjoy our time.  I had the 3 for 10.00 special and my parents had create your own fajitas.  The only problem we encountered which was small was the waitress gave me salad instead of chips and salsa. Our original waitress corrected the minor problem.  Refills and good conversation were flowing that evening.  Ill be back to this location again.

Visited this location three times. I didn't want to write a review until I gave it a fair shot.  This location is somewhat obscured. It's right off of i83, but not on the main road (York Rd).  It's a stand alone Restauarant next to a hotel.  The area is somewhat industrial. There are a lot of trucks, the light rail, etc.  Ordering to-go was easy and simple. Is your best option, but, check your order before you leave.  I visited one evening, around 9 pm, where we were promptly ignored for almost 20 mins. It wasn't crowded, but this location rarely is crowded, because it's location is somewhat in the cut. After alerting the management we left.  Decided come back another time, I know I am a glutton for punishment, but I'm a points member & love the chips with salsa.  On my last occasion, we came earlier in the day during lunch. It still wasn't a typical crowd, like I am used to seeing at a Chilis. The staff were attentive. However, there were FLIES everywhere. in between the booths, around our food, on some of the other tables. NOPE NOPE NOPE.  Will not visit this location ever again!

This was the worst experience of my life. The manager was extremely rude and threatened to spit in my food!!!! I will never go to another Chilis in my life. I do not know her name but she accused me of stealing a bowl and gave me a nasty attitude. The manager also threw in some racist remarks! By the way the steaks there are extremely dry! NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!

I was staying at the Holiday Inn that is connected to this Chili's, so I was able to frequent this establishment often.  Every time I arrived, I was always promptly greeted and seated.  Everyone was always so friendly and helpful.  I got to try a lot of great tasting food that always came out hot or cold, depending on the dish, and the drinks were plentiful.  I never had to ask for refills.  The place as a whole is clean and neat.  Bathrooms don't smell nor were they messy.  Yes, I'd come back!  I loved the Buffalo Cauliflower and watermelon margaritas the best!!!

This is a convenient restaurant connected to a hotel. The food is okay. There is a decent amount of options available, from burgers to ribs. The chicken and prime rib enchiladas came with a good amount of meat and was filling. The sour cream, salsa, pick de gallo, lime, cheese, and guacamole have some life to the meal. The buffalo wings were pretty crispy and tasted pretty good. The celery that came with it looked kind of old. The shrimp tacos were not too good and were kind of plain. The mango chicken plate was okay. The chicken was soft and the mangos gave it a nice tropical punch. The salad is overly drenched in dressing and was not fresh.  Customer service really depends on who the waiter is. I find that the male waiters were much better to deal with. I was ignored by the hostess when she accommodated a pair of men that arrived after me. Ordering to go at the bar area during lunch was the worse experience ever. I ended up being ignored by the waitress for over 10 minutes even though she passed by me at least five times. I ended ordering over the phone while sitting in the bar area.
Poor carry out experience. Window was closed. Waited 5 minutes for the host. Bar was in charge of carry out and took 10 minutes for her attention. If I go back it will be at a different location.
The staff here are very courteous and attentive. When I come I get the southwestern eggrolls. Chilis definitely have the best of any food chain.
